newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Banespa takeover is approved - paper.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Banespa takeover is approved - paper.

text.p: Sao Paulo state lawmakers approved late Wednesday a deal allowing Sao Paulo state bank Banespa to be taken over by the federal government, local newspapers said.
The takeover of Banespa by the federal government is part of a rescheduling deal, signed with federal officials last month, for a major part of Sao Paulo state's huge debt.
The deal covers Sao Paulo's debts with its banks Banespa and Nossa Caixa Nosso Banco, and outstanding debts in the form of public securities. Banespa is owed the biggest amount, 20.6 billion reais.
Under the deal, Sao Paulo state government will sell a 51 percent stake in its bank Banespa at a price to be determined after one year.
While in federal hands for one year, the bank will be run by an independent manager which will be hired in a bidding process.
Banespa, Brazil's largest state bank, has been under central bank management since December 1994 because of financial problems caused by Sao Paulo's debts with it.

Although government officials have declined to say whether Banespa will be privatized, most observers say the bank's fate is the sell-off as chances for the bank to return to state control are virtually null.
The bank's liquidation is also seen as out of question.
